pages.name: By Consent
pages.description:
Before filing your application for case management order, it is good practice to contact the other party to see if they will `consent` to the order. If they consent, it can save you time and energy. If they do agree to the case management order, you can choose to either:
  • prepare the Consent Order Form 18, or
  • go to a court appearance

elements.name: givenConsent
elements.title: Have all parties {firstQuestionText} consented to the order you are asking the court to make?

elements.name: givenConsentDescription
elements.title:
Since everyone agrees to the case management order you are asking for, you can choose to either:
  • file a Consent Order Form 18 signed by everyone, or
  • go to a court appearance
If you file a consent order, it usually means a judge can review your application and approve your order without you having to go to court. You need to make sure all the parties and any other person who may be affected by the order sign the consent order.
Sometimes, it might be hard for you to prepare the consent order yourself, or to get everyone to sign it, in which case you can ask for a court appearance. The choice is yours.
